All so called progressive and left leaning politicians should be able to speak as plainly as Jamaal Bowman is here.

author: @lucariojet
text:
The thing that I find so incredible about your work Olay is how you continue to move me further left by "moving me to the right." 

So much of our system I didn't (and still don't) believe in but attempting to solely act outside of it is impossible and I've used it to isolate and as an excuse to not fully engage with what's happening. The power will never be fully used for us, but any power we can obtain and use in our benefit can be valuable. Not to mention, these conversations are bringing me closer to those democratic and centrist individuals, the real people I want to see succeed and benefit from the changes we wish to implement. 

It's teaching me patience and trust and how not to let what feels like big losses dissuade me from continuing to work towards the world I want to see.

author: @avirichar4981
text:
exactly, about the debunking around half way through the vid, for those who are confused to think being front and center on any issues *alongside* the racial justice and anti-racism ones: as Rep. Bowman pointed out earlier on here, white supremacy and nationalism [and by extension it's extreme essentialist and fundamentalist and fanatical form, known as nazi-ism, whether in Germany or in the U.S. or in Israel where it's called zionism] and settler colonialism

these are just the M.O., the go-to modes of obvious and direct application, of capitalism's extremes and class-based injustice and classism 101, where it's everyone's plight being crushed, and the racial modes are the modus operandi, the quickest and most blatant and easiest to over-simplistically apply

but you/I/we can't fix the symptoms, if we never cure the cause of the disease and injury, it will keep being repeated over and over and over if the cause remains, which is rooted in the same depraved anti-human way of doing things, whether the most obvious forms of it are racially oriented attacks or otherwise, and as long as the forms that are otherwise are ignored for the sake of *only* addressing the ones that are *most* racially obvious (white supremacy and in its most egregiously clear form of anti-blackness, and all that means going back to anti-african-peoples and and being anti everything about the reclaiming of blackness as a vital and real culture now etc.), the solutions and victories in the realm of anti-racism will only be superficial, and will never last

it's so hard to see this past all the scarcity-based crushing oppression that we all live through day in day out, but it's so important to realize, it's *humanity* that we share and that we are fighting for, in *all* the fights, and if we leave out any humanity we leave out all humanity, simple as that (in the good way of simple principles, sublimely true, proven over and over by history and experiential existence)
